TI: Volumetric measurement of the hippocampus, the anterior cingulate cortex, and the retrosplenial granular cortex of the rat using structural MRI.
AB: MRI imaging of the rodent brain is a rapidly growing field in the neurosciences. Relatively limited information is available for regional volume determination. The present paper describes a reliable method for the assessment of the hippocampus, the anterior cingulate cortex, the retrosplenial granular cortex and the ventricles in rats. MRI scans were acquired using a 7 T magnet. The anatomical sampling method was found to be highly reliable with an intra-rater reliability of greater than 0.93. The current protocol should facilitate future in vivo neuroimaging research using animal models of neurodegenerative diseases.
AD: Center for Brain Health, Neuroimaging Laboratory, NYU School of Medicine, New York, NY 10016, USA. oliver.wolf@uni-duesseldorf.de
SO: Brain Res Brain Res Protoc. 2002 Aug;10(1):41-6.
